column4: does anyone here use a USB wireless connection adapter on ubuntu ?
yes, a d-link dwl-g122 (rev. b1)
just loaded the rt2570 module
no, rt2570 is part of the kernel modules
why did you compile anyway? the rt2570 module should be there
it should be somewhere under /lib/modules/<your_kernel_version>
try modinfo rt2570 to see if it is installed
you didnt say you were using encryption
also you didnt say which wireless usb adapter you have
first you have to check which chipset you have in the conceptronic usb adapter
the modinfo output has nothing to do with the chipset on your adapter
it just tells you that the rt2570 module is there
try lsusb when the adapter is plugged in
can you put them on pastebin?
yes, but there is not a linux driver for each and every piece of hardware (thanks to the ignorance of the h/w manufacturers)
i googled a bit for that usb id. it seems the adapter has the ralink rt73 chipset
so why didnt you tell me it is rt73 and not rt2570?
no, rt73 is a separate driver, directly from ralink. fortunately, ralink is a manufacturer who cares about linux.
rt73 is not included in ubuntu, that one has to be built from source. you need packages build-essential and kernel source for that.
certainly not 2.6.17, as you are running 2.6.15
why not install the appropriate kernel-source package with apt-get?
i dont know the exact package name, and i have no ubuntu system right now to look at
yeah, just make sure you get the matching version. compare to "uname -a" output.
